name: Aisha Ali
clarity_response: It's an app where you log and rate things you've done like restaurants and trips.
strongest_line: Track Your Experiences
what_feels_off: Everything. There's no personality, no specificity. It reads like a product spec, not a pitch.
objections: I already have systems that work well enough. This doesn't show me why it's better.
dealbreaker_reason: No clear differentiation from tools I already use.
gut_reaction: This looks like every other tracking app I've seen. Nothing here tells me why this one is different.
unanswered_questions: What does the actual rating interface look like?
price_reaction: $12/month is steep for a tracking app with vague features.

name: Ezra Chen
clarity_response: Some kind of experience tracking app where you rate activities.
strongest_line: Everything is saved in one place
what_feels_off: The testimonials are obviously fake. Nobody says 'I like using this app.'
objections: The copy doesn't demonstrate that anyone who cares about taste built this.
gut_reaction: Extremely generic. The headline 'Track Your Experiences' could be for literally any app.
unanswered_questions: How are categories organized? Are restaurants separate from activities?
price_reaction: I'd need to see serious value in the social layer to justify $12/month.

name: Daniela O'Brien
clarity_response: An app to track and rate restaurants, bars, and activities you've been to.
strongest_line: Rate restaurants, bars, activities, trips, and more
what_feels_off: It's so generic it could be describing 50 different apps.
objections: No evidence this app understands the difference between tracking and curating.
gut_reaction: I got bored halfway through. There's no personality here at all.
unanswered_questions: Can I import my existing lists from Notes or Google Maps?
price_reaction: The free plan seems usable. I probably wouldn't upgrade based on this page.

name: Kai Franklin
clarity_response: It logs your experiences and lets you rate them. Also has some social feature.
strongest_line: See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: The headline 'Track Your Experiences' sounds like a spreadsheet feature, not a lifestyle product.
objections: I'd need to see the actual interface. This description could be anything.
gut_reaction: It feels like someone described a Notes app with a login page. Why would I switch?
unanswered_questions: How does the recommendation algorithm work?
price_reaction: $12/month puts this in the range of Spotify or a streaming service. Not comparable value.

name: Diego Larsson
clarity_response: A tracking app for things you do — restaurants, trips, that sort of thing.
strongest_line: Log — Add an experience to your profile
what_feels_off: There's nothing here about taste or curation. It's just tracking. I track plenty already.
objections: Why would I pay $12/month for something my Notes app does free?
dealbreaker_reason: No clear differentiation from tools I already use.
gut_reaction: The concept is fine but the copy doesn't make me feel anything. Just... flat.
unanswered_questions: What data do you collect and how is privacy handled?
price_reaction: I'd consider $5/month. $12 is a hard sell without a trial.

name: Isaiah Singh
clarity_response: It's like a rating app for your real-life experiences.
strongest_line: Track Your Experiences
what_feels_off: The whole page feels like it was written by someone who has never used a product like this.
objections: How does the rating system work? One star to five? Detailed? Not explained at all.
gut_reaction: I already do this in my head. This page gives me zero reason to change that.
unanswered_questions: Is there a way to tag or add context to ratings beyond a number?
price_reaction: The premium features aren't described well enough to evaluate the price.

name: Malachi Kim
clarity_response: An app that helps you remember places you've been and rate them.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: No specificity anywhere. No examples, no scenarios, no personality.
objections: No mention of how it handles different categories. Restaurants and hikes aren't the same.
dealbreaker_reason: Social features behind paywall means limited network value.
gut_reaction: Reads like it was written by someone who's never been excited about a restaurant in their life.
unanswered_questions: How do friend recommendations actually surface? Push notifications? Feed?
price_reaction: Feels overpriced for what's described. Maybe fair if the app is incredible.

name: Nia Adeyemi
clarity_response: You log experiences and rate them, and you can see what friends rated.
strongest_line: Everything is saved in one place so you can look back
what_feels_off: It feels AI-written. Competent but completely soulless.
objections: I have no reason to believe the social features are meaningfully different from texting recs.
gut_reaction: It's clear enough but painfully bland. Nothing here speaks to someone who actually cares about taste.
unanswered_questions: Can I export my data?
price_reaction: $12/month for 'advanced recommendations' that aren't explained? No.

name: Leila Williams
clarity_response: It's an experience journal where you rate things and share with friends.
strongest_line: Rate — Give it a rating
what_feels_off: The problem section asks 'do you ever forget what you've done?' — condescending tone.
objections: The free plan seems crippled. 'Basic' tracking vs what? Not clear.
gut_reaction: This feels like a homework assignment, not a product someone's passionate about.
unanswered_questions: How many people are currently using this?
price_reaction: I'd need a free trial before committing to $12/month.

name: Deja Kowalski
clarity_response: An app to rate and track restaurants, bars, trips, and other activities.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: Premium for 'full history' implies the free version deletes your data? That's concerning.
objections: I don't trust products that can't explain themselves with specificity.
gut_reaction: Fine as a description, useless as a sales pitch. I already know what experience tracking is.
unanswered_questions: What's the team behind this?
price_reaction: The free plan should include social. Paywalling it limits the whole product.

name: Carmen Russo
clarity_response: A logging app for experiences with ratings and some friend features.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: The 'How It Works' is Log, Rate, Browse. That's not a compelling workflow.
objections: Who built this? There's no team credibility or origin story.
dealbreaker_reason: Social features behind paywall means limited network value.
gut_reaction: The testimonials are clearly fake and the rest is forgettable.
unanswered_questions: How does it handle different cities if I travel?
price_reaction: Not unreasonable if it works but this page doesn't convince me it works.

name: Marcus Rivera
clarity_response: Basically a tracker for restaurants and activities with ratings.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: Nothing about what makes this different from Google Maps lists or Apple Notes.
objections: What happens to my data? Can I export my ratings? No info on this.
gut_reaction: Nothing about this suggests the team understands how I actually think about experiences.
unanswered_questions: Is there a web version or just mobile?
price_reaction: I'd pay $12/month for an app I love. This page doesn't make me think I'd love it.

name: Ananya Chowdhury
clarity_response: An app where you track what you've done and share ratings with friends.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: The social features are an afterthought. Three vague sentences for the most important part.
objections: None of my friends would sign up based on this page. If they won't use it, it's useless to me.
gut_reaction: It's fine but there's nothing here that would make me stop scrolling.
unanswered_questions: How do I invite friends? Is there friction in onboarding them?
price_reaction: Paywalling social features is a terrible idea for an app that needs network effects.

name: Amir Tanaka
clarity_response: It lets you log experiences and see what your friends have rated.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: Those testimonials would actively discourage me. They're clearly not real people.
objections: Social features behind a paywall means nobody in my friend group will get the full experience.
dealbreaker_reason: Social features paywalled — kills network effect.
gut_reaction: The friend features are buried and barely described. That's the only part I'd care about.
unanswered_questions: Can I share my profile or recommendations outside the app?
price_reaction: $12/month when my friends would need to pay too? Not going to happen.

name: Keiko Yamamoto
clarity_response: Some kind of social experience tracker where you rate stuff and friends see it.
strongest_line: See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: 'Connect with friends to share recommendations' — that's literally just texting.
objections: I need to see the social features working to believe they're useful. This page doesn't show me.
gut_reaction: Reads like a template. No energy, no specificity, no reason to care.
unanswered_questions: What happens when only I have the app and my friends don't?
price_reaction: The free plan without social features is useless to me.

name: Rohan Shah
clarity_response: An app for logging and rating activities, with a social sharing component.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: The whole page is about tracking, but the value for me is in the friend network.
objections: How is this better than a group chat where we share recs?
gut_reaction: I already have a phone full of text threads with recs. Why would I add another app?
unanswered_questions: How do friend recommendations actually work mechanically?
price_reaction: I'd pay if my friends were already on it. But they're not, and this page won't convince them.

name: Omar Hayes
clarity_response: It tracks your experiences and connects you with friends' recommendations.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: No specificity at all. What kind of experiences? How do friend recs actually work?
objections: The testimonials are fake and that makes me trust nothing else on the page.
gut_reaction: The 'what people are saying' section is embarrassing. Those aren't real quotes.
unanswered_questions: Is there a feed? Notifications when friends rate something?
price_reaction: Social features should be free. Charge for analytics or premium insights.

name: Aaliyah Martinez
clarity_response: A rating app for experiences that also shows what friends are doing.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: The pricing is backwards — social features should be free to drive adoption.
objections: I'd need my whole friend group to adopt this for it to work. What's the onboarding like?
gut_reaction: I'd need to see way more about how the social part actually works before I'd consider this.
unanswered_questions: Can I create shared lists or plans with friends?
price_reaction: $12/month to see what friends rate when I can just text them? Bad deal.

name: Nadia Hoffman
clarity_response: You rate experiences and can browse what friends have rated.
strongest_line: Browse — See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: It reads like someone listed features instead of telling me why I'd care.
objections: The free plan is just personal tracking. That's not why I'd use this.
gut_reaction: Generic to the point of being invisible. I'd forget this page existed in 5 minutes.
unanswered_questions: How is this different from just having a group chat?
price_reaction: Too expensive for what's described. I'd want a trial first.

name: Cedric Cruz
clarity_response: An experience tracking app with a social layer for friend recommendations.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: There's no energy here. It's the beige wall paint of landing pages.
objections: No mention of how easy it is to share recs. Sharing is literally my use case.
gut_reaction: The description of social features is three sentences. That's the whole pitch? Pass.
unanswered_questions: What's the onboarding experience like for someone I invite?
price_reaction: The pricing model is backwards. Social should drive free adoption.

name: Dante Cooper
clarity_response: It's an app where you log experiences and see friends' activity.
strongest_line: See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: The word 'log' feels like work. I don't want to log things, I want to share them.
objections: What's the cold-start problem like? Is it useful before friends join?
gut_reaction: Feels like a project someone made for a class, not something I'd trust with my social data.
unanswered_questions: Can I send recs to people who aren't on the app?
price_reaction: If the social features were free I'd try it tomorrow. With the paywall, never.

name: Rachel Patel
clarity_response: A social experience tracker — rate things, see what friends rate.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: 'Most people don't have a good way to keep track' — weak problem statement.
objections: I can't tell if this is a personal tool or a social platform. The page is confused.
gut_reaction: Nothing wrong with it, nothing right with it. Just... there.
unanswered_questions: How many active users do you have?
price_reaction: $12 feels like a lot for something that depends on friends also paying $12.

name: Megan Nakamura
clarity_response: An app for tracking and rating experiences with friend sharing features.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: It doesn't address the main question: why would my friends use this?
objections: Why would I pay for social features that require my friends to also be on the app?
gut_reaction: If my friend sent me this link I'd assume they accidentally shared the wrong thing.
unanswered_questions: Is the social experience good with 3 friends or do you need 30?
price_reaction: I can't evaluate the price because the social features aren't described well enough.

name: Tariq Oduya
clarity_response: It helps you log experiences and discover what friends recommend.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: This feels like a pitch for a utility, not something I'd tell friends about.
objections: $12/month to see friends' ratings when Instagram is free? Hard sell.
gut_reaction: The free plan is just personal ratings? So the part that matters — friends — costs $12/month?
unanswered_questions: Can I categorize friends by taste type?
price_reaction: Monthly subscription for a social app feels wrong. Annual might work.

name: Tobias Kapoor
clarity_response: Another experience tracking app where you log and rate stuff.
strongest_line: Track Your Experiences
what_feels_off: The entire page assumes I'll actually use the app regularly. That's the whole problem.
objections: I've tried this before. Multiple times. This page gives me no reason to believe it'll be different.
gut_reaction: Here we go again. Another tracking app that thinks the problem is that I don't have an app.
unanswered_questions: How long does it take to log one experience?
price_reaction: $12/month for something I'll probably abandon? Absolutely not.

name: Yuki Lee
clarity_response: It tracks your experiences. You rate things. There's a social feature.
strongest_line: Everything is saved in one place
what_feels_off: No mention of how easy it is. If it takes more than 10 seconds I'm out.
objections: The effort required isn't addressed at all. That's my #1 concern and it's not mentioned.
dealbreaker_reason: No mention of effort or time per entry. Red flag.
gut_reaction: I've literally tried this exact concept four times. Nothing here tells me why attempt five would be different.
unanswered_questions: Is there any automation — location detection, photo import?
price_reaction: I'm not paying anything until I've used the free version for at least 3 months.

name: Kenji Johansson
clarity_response: An app for logging activities and rating them. Pretty standard.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: 'Log — Add an experience to your profile' sounds tedious already.
objections: If this is another app that requires me to manually log things, I'll abandon it in a week.
dealbreaker_reason: Premium for 'full history' suggests free data gets deleted.
gut_reaction: The word 'log' makes me want to close the tab. I don't want to log anything.
unanswered_questions: What keeps me coming back after the first week?
price_reaction: The premium features aren't compelling enough to upgrade.

name: Jenna Okafor
clarity_response: It's an experience logger with ratings. Also has friend features for premium.
strongest_line: Rate — Give it a rating
what_feels_off: It doesn't acknowledge that people have tried this before and failed. Feels naive.
objections: No mention of automation, push notifications, or any mechanism to keep me engaged.
gut_reaction: Zero personality. Zero urgency. I'd download this, open it once, and never think about it again.
unanswered_questions: Is there a reminder system?
price_reaction: $12/month is what I pay for apps I use daily. This won't be one of those.

name: Theo Diaz
clarity_response: Yet another app to track and rate your experiences.
strongest_line: Log — Add an experience to your profile
what_feels_off: The testimonials are insultingly generic. These aren't real people.
objections: Premium for full history? So my free data gets deleted? That's a dealbreaker.
gut_reaction: This is the app equivalent of a blank journal someone gives you for Christmas. Looks fine, never used.
unanswered_questions: What happens to my data on the free plan? Does history get deleted?
price_reaction: Too expensive. And 'full history' behind a paywall is concerning.

name: Finn Delgado
clarity_response: A logging app for experiences — restaurants, trips, activities. With ratings.
strongest_line: Everything is saved in one place so you can look back
what_feels_off: Premium for 'advanced recommendations'? You haven't explained basic recommendations.
objections: I'd need a free trial of premium to even consider this. No way I'm paying upfront.
gut_reaction: The copy doesn't acknowledge that people like me exist — the ones who've failed at this before.
unanswered_questions: Can I rate retroactively or only in the moment?
price_reaction: I'd need a money-back guarantee. My app abandonment rate is too high.

name: Chloe Vasquez
clarity_response: It tracks experiences and lets you rate them. Friends feature costs extra.
strongest_line: Track Your Experiences
what_feels_off: There's nothing about automation, reminders, or making this effortless.
objections: The 'how it works' is literally just three generic steps. Not convincing.
dealbreaker_reason: Same concept I've abandoned four times. Nothing new here.
gut_reaction: Another app asking me to build a habit. Hard pass without a better reason.
unanswered_questions: How is this different from every other tracking app?
price_reaction: No free trial mentioned? That's a red flag for a subscription app.

name: Tara Ibrahim
clarity_response: An experience tracking and rating app. Social features behind a paywall.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: The copy reads like every other app I've downloaded and abandoned.
objections: Show me the interface. Show me it takes 5 seconds. Words alone won't work on me.
gut_reaction: Premium plan for 'full history'? So the free version doesn't even save everything? Already annoyed.
unanswered_questions: What's the minimum viable use? Do I need to rate everything?
price_reaction: I'd consider paying once I've proven to myself I'll actually use it. So probably never.

name: Camille Bautista
clarity_response: You log experiences, rate them, and can see friends' ratings if you pay.
strongest_line: Everything is saved in one place
what_feels_off: It feels like it was written by someone who finishes every journal they start.
objections: Every app says 'log and rate.' None of them make it easy enough.
dealbreaker_reason: Premium for 'full history' suggests free data gets deleted.
gut_reaction: I can feel myself losing interest as I read this, and that's exactly the problem.
unanswered_questions: Is there any AI that auto-suggests entries based on location?
price_reaction: $12/month is aggressive for an unproven app from an unknown company.

name: Ethan Bennett
clarity_response: Another experience journal app. Rate things, track them, share with friends.
strongest_line: Log — Add an experience to your profile
what_feels_off: No mention of how long it takes to rate something. That's the only thing I care about.
objections: No social proof from people like me — people who've tried and failed before.
gut_reaction: The testimonials sound AI-generated. 'I like using this app' — nobody talks like that.
unanswered_questions: How many people actually stick with this after a month?
price_reaction: The price isn't the issue. The issue is I don't believe I'll use it long enough to justify any price.

name: Elena Stein
clarity_response: It's a tracking app for activities and experiences with a rating system.
strongest_line: Rate — Give it a rating
what_feels_off: 'Track Your Experiences' is the same pitch every failed journal app uses.
objections: The page doesn't address retention at all. How do you keep me coming back after week one?
gut_reaction: Reads like it was written by an algorithm. No human voice, no soul.
unanswered_questions: What's the app's retention rate?
price_reaction: If 'full history' is premium, what happens to my old entries on free? Shady.

name: Miles Owens
clarity_response: An app to log and rate experiences. The social stuff is premium.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: Zero acknowledgment that the problem isn't lack of tools — it's follow-through.
objections: I'm not paying $12/month for an app I'll probably stop using.
gut_reaction: I'd bet money I'd stop using this within 10 days.
unanswered_questions: Can I import from other apps I've abandoned?
price_reaction: Even $3/month would feel like a waste if I stop using it after a week.

name: Kira Petrov
clarity_response: An app that helps you remember and rate things you've done.

what_feels_off: It doesn't make me feel anything. Tracking isn't exciting.
objections: This tracks what I've done but doesn't help me figure out what to do next.
gut_reaction: It's not bad but it doesn't make me feel like my life would change. Just another app.
unanswered_questions: How does the discovery feature actually work?
price_reaction: $12/month is a lot for an app I'm not sure I need.

name: Maya Park
clarity_response: It tracks your experiences and lets you see what friends are doing.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: The problem section is weak. 'Do you ever forget?' isn't the issue — the issue is not doing enough.
objections: I need discovery and inspiration, not a database of my past.
gut_reaction: I have enough apps. What about this is supposed to excite me?
unanswered_questions: Will this help me find things to do or just record what I've done?
price_reaction: I'd try it free first and maybe upgrade if the discovery features are good.

name: Mila Bergström
clarity_response: Some kind of experience tracking app with ratings and friend features.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: Fake testimonials. Obviously. Makes me trust the whole thing less.

unanswered_questions: Is there a recommendation feed based on my location?
price_reaction: Feels overpriced compared to free alternatives that do similar things.

name: Nico Brooks
clarity_response: An app to log and rate restaurants, bars, and activities.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: There's nothing aspirational here. It's functional, not inspirational.

gut_reaction: Feels like something a friend's startup would make. Supportive energy, not buying energy.
unanswered_questions: How does the app handle someone who hasn't done much yet?
price_reaction: $12/month for a lifestyle app? Maybe if it actually changed my habits.

name: Soren Lam

what_feels_off: It tells me to track what I do but doesn't help me do more interesting things.

unanswered_questions: Do I need friends on the app for it to be useful?
price_reaction: I'd need to see the premium features working before paying.

name: Hana Reyes

name: Joaquin Jensen

name: Zoe Fernandez

name: Priya Chang

name: Mateo Griffin

name: Ravi Okonkwo

what_feels_off: It doesn't address FOMO at all. It tracks what I've done, not what I should do.

name: Jordan Nguyen
clarity_response: A tracking and rating app for experiences, plus friend recommendations.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: Feels like homework. 'Log your experience.' No thanks.

gut_reaction: Maybe if the copy had any personality I'd care more. Right now it's a nothing page.
unanswered_questions: How do I find interesting people to follow?
price_reaction: Free plan sounds limited but $12/month sounds like a lot for finding things to do.

name: Samir Novak
clarity_response: An app to track and rate places you've been — restaurants, bars, activities.

what_feels_off: Nothing about discovering a new city. It's all about remembering, not exploring.

price_reaction: $12/month is a lot when I don't know anyone on the platform yet.

name: Declan Watanabe

name: Iris Torres

what_feels_off: No mention of neighborhoods, areas, local knowledge — the stuff I actually need.

price_reaction: Reasonable price if the product delivers, but this page doesn't convince me.

name: Reese Mensah
clarity_response: It lets you log and rate things you've done and browse friends' ratings.
strongest_line: See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: The testimonials are clearly fabricated. Undermines any credibility.
objections: Nothing about location-aware features, nearby recommendations, or exploration.
gut_reaction: The friend feature could be amazing for someone in my position but it's barely explained.
unanswered_questions: How does the app handle neighborhood-level recommendations?
price_reaction: $12/month for friend-based discovery when I have no local friends on it? Pointless.

name: Leo Abadi
clarity_response: An experience tracking app where you rate stuff and connect with friends.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: It positions itself as backward-looking (remember what you did) instead of forward-looking (find what to do).
objections: I'd need the social features free to start building my network. Paywall kills adoption.
gut_reaction: This feels like every other app in the 'lifestyle' category. Nothing stands out.
unanswered_questions: Is it useful from day one or only after I build up ratings?
price_reaction: I'd want a free trial. New to a city = budget-conscious.

name: Simone Baptiste
clarity_response: It tracks your experiences, lets you rate them, and shows friends' picks.
strongest_line: An app to help you remember the things you do
what_feels_off: There's no mention of location-based anything. Isn't that the point?
objections: No mention of how this connects me with local knowledge or local users.
gut_reaction: I'd want to know more about how discovery works but the page barely mentions it.
unanswered_questions: Can I browse by category and area?
price_reaction: The premium features are exactly what I need but I can't justify paying before I've tried them.

name: Jasmine Anderson
clarity_response: An app for logging and rating activities, restaurants, and trips.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: It sounds like it's for people who already have routines. I'm still building mine.
objections: It doesn't solve my actual problem: figuring out what's worth going back to.
gut_reaction: The concept makes sense but the execution of this page is lifeless.
unanswered_questions: How do I connect with people who know my city well?
price_reaction: Too expensive to gamble on. Needs a free trial or freemium social features.

name: Ingrid Gupta
clarity_response: A tracker for experiences — you rate things and can see what friends rated.
strongest_line: See what your friends are doing on the app
what_feels_off: Generic enough to be about any city in the world. No specificity at all.
objections: The copy treats all experiences the same. A coffee shop and a weekend trip are different.
gut_reaction: Helpful idea, boring presentation. I'd keep scrolling.
unanswered_questions: Does it work internationally or only in the US?
price_reaction: I'd pay $12/month happily if I could see it working first.

name: Caleb Santos
clarity_response: It's an app that tracks what you've done and lets you rate it.
strongest_line: Browse — See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: The 'how it works' section is so bare-bones it tells me nothing about the actual experience.
objections: I'd need to see some proof that the recommendations are better than Eater or TimeOut.
gut_reaction: For someone building a new social life this could be great. But you'd never know that from this page.
unanswered_questions: Is there a way to plan an exploration route?
price_reaction: Feels like the pricing penalizes new users who need the social features most.

name: Noah Malik
clarity_response: An experience logging app with ratings and social recommendations.
strongest_line: This can help you find new things to try
what_feels_off: Premium includes 'advanced recommendations' — what does that even mean?
objections: Bland page, no personality. Doesn't feel like a product made by people who love exploring.
gut_reaction: It reads like a manual, not an invitation. I want to feel excited about exploring.
unanswered_questions: How granular are the categories?
price_reaction: The free plan should be more generous to build the user base.

name: Andre Morales
clarity_response: You track and rate experiences, and the social feature shows friends' activity.
strongest_line: See what your friends have rated
what_feels_off: Nothing in the copy suggests this understands what it's like to be new somewhere.
objections: Where's the onboarding for new-to-a-city users? That should be front and center.
gut_reaction: I need a reason to believe this is better than my Google Maps saves. This page doesn't give me one.
unanswered_questions: Can I see density maps of highly-rated spots?
price_reaction: Price is okay but the value isn't articulated well enough.

name: Olivia Dubois
clarity_response: An app for tracking experiences in your city and seeing friends' ratings.
strongest_line: Connect with friends to share recommendations
what_feels_off: Reads like an app for people who already know what they like. I'm still figuring it out.
objections: I can't tell if this is useful solo or only useful with a network.
gut_reaction: The bare minimum of information with zero emotional hook.
unanswered_questions: What's the cold-start experience like?
price_reaction: I'd wait for a promo or yearly plan before subscribing.
